sentence: I have several of these bucket boss cable bags for stowing coaxial cable . I have been satisfied with them since day one .

These are for a very specific and limited set of tools , most of which are discontinued (but one of which I have and like a lot ) . But they are good tools and the continued availability of the batteries makes them continually useful . As to the batteries , they are excellent , hold charge well , and power the tool up to its design level . These NiMH batteries are much preferred over the older weaker model . And prices vary widely on the internet and the Amazon price was excellent . I also hope that Amazon has at least a modest demand for these so that stocks are not too old , though I haven 't figured out a way to evaluate that .

My method of use : Fill up the air pot with hot water from the Bunn coffee maker the night before . In the morning water is still hot to touch , not scauding but hot . Make a full pot of coffee , pour into the airpot . An hour later make another pot and pour in , this enough coffee until late afternoon . This is a made in Japan product , but that is better than made in China . Which I would have done without if made China .

I still have the old charger and the battery that was on that one did a much better job , but there still wasn 't the same amount of suction . sentence: I bought this to clear out the Live Oak leaves from a 500 square foot dichondra lawn in front of a condo . ( We have lawn guys , but they kill larger xeriscaping with a serial killer -ish glee : I finally got them to stop by saying I 'd do my yard myself -which means I get to blow out the leaves once a month . ) Getting leaves out with this little blower works incredibly well - -it 's fast and very powerful . You 'll need ear and eye protection , because it 's loud and powerful , but with that caveat , I have no complaints . Recommended .

I was really dubious about the price of this can , but the watering head broke on my old cheap can in almost no time , so I took the chance . As the months have passed , I 've grown more and more attached to it . Holds plenty of water or liquid fertilizer . Nice gentle spray for leaf feeding my small and challenged plants with Miracle Grow fertilizer solution . Nice reach with the spout (tip removed ) to get near the base of larger plants for efficient fertilizing and insect /disease treatment with Bayer Liquid plant products . The translucent measuring neck is quite helpful here . Very very durable . Easy to store when collapsed . Bright cheery color adds a little sunshine on a cloudy day . All in all , money well spent .
Didn 't kill the powdery mildew that eventually killed my cucumber , acorn squash , yellow squash , and zucchini . I call .

sentence: We asked before purchasing if this had a grommet or something to hold the flag up on the pole . The nylon material is very slippery . We were told that it did . Some purchasers even said they had a leather strap to hold the flag in place at the top of the pole . We didn 't get either a grommet or strap . My husband had to punch a hole in at the top so we could secure it , so the top of it wouldn 't slide down on the pole . A grommet would have been excellent . Those reviewers that complained about the stars not positioned correctly are right , but it is not visible from the street . We live in sunny SoCal with daily winds . After 18 months it is faded and tattered at the corners . We purchased this Nov 2015 , and it needs replacing . The attached photo shows the current condition of the flag after 18 months . Not sure I would recommend this or buy again .
Have had it for a few months now , working great ! Looks like it is made well and should last a while .

It 's not squirrel proof like my last one , but it 's outside my back window so if we yell and tap on the window the squirrels run away . Although I liked my last feeder , the walls around the seed was made of plexiglass , and it fell from the post I had on , and shattered ! Unfortunately , this one has done that too . ( I gotta find a different way to mount my birdfeeder ! ) The difference is for this one it just had a bent perch which I straightened out with pliers , but nothing shattered like the last one .

I bought Roundup to take care of some persistent problem areas . I gave the weeds a light spray . Results were shown after a few days and grew stronger after a week or two . I gave the stragglers another light spray after 2 weeks . That took care of them . After a while you can expect weeds to gradually return as they are opportunists . But in some areas I sprayed there has been no return yet . This has even taken care of some saplings . Be careful not to over spray onto plants you want to keep , Roundup does not discriminate . And be patient with it , you will not see instant results , there is no point in using more product than necessary .
entities: Results were shown after a few days
grew stronger after a week or two
has even taken care of some saplings
some areas I sprayed there has been no return yet

I bought this just under 2 years ago . It came with charger and 2 batteries . . It usually takes both batteries power to finish up whatever i 'm doing . . I use this literally every day in my house ! I have all tile floors and 5 cats . Cats tails are like dust mops , they bring in every small stick , leaf and every thing else and deposit it across the floor . One fo the first things I do everyday is open the front door and blow out every damn thing they dragged in . Sadly with time the batteries were lasting less and less time . I charge them every day then store them in a drawer (not the hot garage ) butthey 've totaly quit charging now . So I 'll try to replace the batteries . . I 'm not even sure if I need a new charger too . . . I 'm disappointed these batteries wore out so quickly . ' that 's too big an expense to replace so often . As for the blower itself it is very light weight and easy to use .

This is a great 2 way connector . The faucet is always on and I have not had a leak issue . I used teflon tape when I attached the two hoses just to be on the safe side as I knew the faucet would be remaining on . One hose feeds an outdoor shower and the other is for a gardening hose . The outdoor shower line is on all the time and the water operated from directly from the shower controls . The garden hose is on only when I 'm watering it so I use the small inline switch to turn the water off and on for that line .

This chain saw is not for huge jobs , but for cleaning out roots from beds or for sprucing up a tree which has become a bit over grown between seasons , this saw does the job .
